sentences: Minulla on tunne, että hän rakastaa sinua.
context: The word 'sinua' is the partitive singular form of the pronoun 'sinä', which means 'you'. The partitive case in Finnish is used for incomplete objects, among other things. So, 'sinua' translates to 'you' (as an object), often implying 'to you' or 'for you' depending on the context of the sentence.
